subject: why are the Assert methods static?
msgSnippet: Hi, I ve run into something interesting that I hope will ultimately improve my understanding of good Java design.  I want to extend JUnit to do logging
messageBody:
Hi, I've run into something interesting that I hope will ultimately
improve my understanding of good Java design. I want to extend JUnit to
do logging asserts, that is, print out a message every time one of the
assert* methods is executed.

Looking at the source code for the Assert class, I see that every
assert* method eventually either funnels through the assertTrue(String
message, boolean condition) method or throws an exception. So, I
thought, all I have to do is provide my own assertTrue method that
prints a message and then call Assert's assertTrue. But then I realized
that all the assert* methods are static.

So, the only way I can think of to do what I want is to provide my own
assert* method for each of Assert's many assert* methods, so my own get
called (since Assert's are now hidden). But there must be a better
approach, as this one definitely doesn't "feel" right.

Question 1: Why are the assert* methods in Assert static?

Question 2: Is there a better testrunner-independent way of printing out
a message for every assertion?


Todd.
